sentences.sContent: She looked back on those days with affection .
sentences.sCn: 她深情地回顾那些日子。

sentences.sContent: Their father never showed them much affection .
sentences.sCn: 他们的父亲对他们从来没有表现出多少慈爱。

sentences.sContent: The church was held in great affection (=  loved and cared about a lot  ) by the local residents.
sentences.sCn: 教会深受当地民众爱戴。

synos.tran: 喜爱，[心理]感情；影响；感染

words.tran: 受到影响的；做作的；假装的
令人感动地；令人伤心地
影响；假装；使…感动（affect的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranOther: a feeling of liking or love and caring
